paper_abstract: Janson and Janson, uczak and Ruciski proved several inequalities for the lower tail of the distribution of the number of events that hold, when all the events are up-sets (increasing events) of a special formeach event is the intersection of some subset of a single set of independent events (i.e., a principal up-set). We show that these inequalities in fact hold for arbitrary up-sets, by modifying existing proofs to use only positive correlation, avoiding the need to assume positive correlation conditioned on one of the events. (c) 2013 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 46, 391-395, 2015
paper_title: The Janson Inequalities for General Up-Sets
